title: 105_hr2568
content:
The Energy Policy Act Amendments of 1997, also known as the "Energy Policy Act Amendments of 1997," includes provisions related to alternative fuels, non-federal programs, and the availability and use of replacement fuels. It covers definitions, amendments to the Energy Policy and Conservation Act, compliance with acquisition requirements, fuel and vehicle neutrality, state and local incentives programs, alternative fuel bus program, alternative fuel use in nonroad vehicles and engines, modification of goals, additional rulemaking authority, credits, and the Secretary's recommendation to Congress. TITLE I--ALTERNATIVE FUELS--GENERAL

SEC. 101. DEFINITIONS. Section 301 of the Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include definitions for heavy duty marine vessels and heavy duty motor vehicles, as well as the term marine vessel. The term 'marine vessel' is defined as a motorized watercraft used for transportation on US navigable waters. Additionally, the definition of 'biological materials' is expanded to include biodiesel mixtures containing 20 percent or more biodiesel with other fuels. SEC. 102 of the Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to allow existing fleet vehicles to be converted to use alternative fuels. Additionally, subsection (g)(2) now includes biodiesel and biodiesel mixtures containing 20 percent or more biodiesel with other fuels. The conversion of fleet vehicles into alternative fueled vehicles is considered an acquisition of alternative fueled vehicles if the original manufacturer's warranty still applies. Acquiring one heavy-duty alternative fueled vehicle is equivalent to acquiring two light-duty alternative fueled vehicles for compliance purposes. The acquisition or conversion of marine vessels to operate on alternative fuels is considered acquiring alternative fueled vehicles for compliance purposes under this title or title IV or V. The acquisition of alternative fuel equal to a year's estimated fuel requirements for a dual-fueled vehicle owned by a fleet or covered person will be credited as acquiring 1 alternative fueled vehicle for compliance purposes. The Secretary may request an accounting of the required acquisition of alternative fuel when allowing this credit. The Secretary will amend guidelines to help Federal agencies comply with acquiring alternative fuel for dual-fueled vehicles. SEC. 104. FUEL AND VEHICLE NEUTRALITY. The Secretary will ensure neutrality in the use of alternative fuels and vehicles in carrying out the Energy Policy Act of 1992. The Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include light duty and heavy duty alternative fueled vehicles and increase the use of alternative fuels. This includes incentives for the use of alternative fuels and reporting requirements. The Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include grants for the purchase of alternative fuels and reporting requirements for the consumption of alternative fuels in vehicles. The Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include reporting requirements for the consumption of alternative fuels in vehicles. Amendments also address the procurement and consumption of alternative fuels. The Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include reporting requirements for the consumption of alternative fuels in vehicles, as well as addressing the procurement and consumption of alternative fuels. Amendments include the incremental cost of alternative fuels used in dual fueled school buses and the conversion of school buses to alternative fueled vehicles. Section 412 of the Energy Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include reporting requirements for alternative fuels in vehicles, specifying studies to be conducted every 6 and 10 years instead of every 2 years. Amendments are made to Section 412 of the Energy Policy Act of 1992, including reporting requirements for alternative fuels in vehicles. Changes involve specifying studies to be conducted every 6 and 10 years instead of every 2 years, and adjustments to language in paragraphs regarding reports and studies. TITLE III--AVAILABILITY AND USE OF REPLACEMENT FUELS, ALTERNATIVE FUELS, AND ALTERNATIVE FUELED PRIVATE VEHICLES

SEC. 301. Modification of goals; additional rulemaking authority. Amends Section 504(a) of the Energy Policy Act of 1992 to change the timeline for goals to be met.

SEC. 302. Credits. Amends Section 508 to include alternative compliance credits for actions related to alternative fueled vehicles.

SEC. 303. Secretary's recommendation to Congress. SEC. 303. Secretary's recommendation to Congress includes expanding public alternative fueled vehicles, exempting replacement fuels from nonreplacement fuel taxes.
